item.title: Christie add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Families will not be broken. Curse and expel them, send their children wandering, drown them in floods and fires, and old women will make songs of all these sorrows and sit on the porch and sing them on mild evenings." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Christie add a quote by Denis Waitley
item.description: "The greatest gifts you can give your children are the roots of responsibility and the wings of independence." -- Denis Waitley

item.title: Christie add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Christie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fringed curtains of thine eye advance, And say what thou seest yond." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Christie add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Christie add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy." -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Christie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Christie add a quote by Louise Gluck
item.description:
"The Red Poppy
The great thing is not having a mind. Feelings: oh, I have those; they govern me. I have a lord in heaven called the sun, and open for him, showing him the fire of my own heart, fire like his presence. What could such glory be if not a heart? Oh my brothers and sisters, were you like me once, long ago, before you were human? Did you permit yourselves to open once, who would never open again? Because in truth I am speaking now the way you do. I speak because I am shattered." -- Louise Gluck

item.title: Christie add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs." -- Donna Tartt
